睇 Descriptive: Naming Styles 呢一章嘅尾，Naming conventions 黎
python唔興真private, 'we are all consenting adults here'

但有部分有特別作用
例如雙底線係頭 有name mangling
你subclass可以揾得返parent class同名method/variable
可以睇埋呢條link最高分回答個例子

Python令人覺得混亂嘅原因就係因為所有嘢都係by reference，class name其實都只係一個variable name指住個class，你大可以寫myInt = int; print(myInt(5.5))，甚至連print function都可以用另一個名: myPrint = print; myPrint("Hello World")，如果你睇返id(int)同id(myInt)，你會發覺係同一舊嘢。亦因為所有嘢都係用id pass嚟pass去，基本上你pass咩都得

Python令人覺得混亂嘅原因就係因為所有嘢都係by reference，class name其實都只係一個variable name指住個class，你大可以寫myInt = int; print(myInt(5.5))，甚至連print function都可以用另一個名: myPrint = print; myPrint("Hello World")，如果你睇返id(int)同id(myInt)，你會發覺係同一舊嘢。亦因為所有嘢都係用id pass嚟pass去，基本上你pass咩都得

補充少少，Python係冇pass by value，佢做到好似pass by value其實都係用immutable object嚟呃你，實際上都係pass by reference (reference of immutable object)

__init__？

其一啦
之前上網見話private就要加
但點先整到private

1. Python無public private const static既概念
2. 底線prefix係private variable convention,意指你唔認該係出面access佢
3. Python重多左樣_ _ xxx _ _

淨係識：
全大寫係constant
底線係前面係private

底線係後面係乜解？ e.g. reg.coef_

淨係識：
全大寫係constant
底線係前面係private

底線係後面係乜解？ e.g. reg.coef_

我既理解一般係用黎避 keyword of python, 例如 class_

__init__？

其一啦
之前上網見話private就要加
但點先整到private

1. Python無public private const static既概念
2. 底線prefix係private variable convention,意指你唔認該係出面access佢
3. Python重多左樣_ _ xxx _ _

之前已經講咗宜家有真Private
Python都做到static/non-static
https://repl.it/MkE0/3

__init__？

其一啦
之前上網見話private就要加
但點先整到private

1. Python無public private const static既概念
2. 底線prefix係private variable convention,意指你唔認該係出面access佢
3. Python重多左樣_ _ xxx _ _

之前已經講咗宜家有真Private
Python都做到static/non-static
https://repl.it/MkE0/3

學習了, 睇左陣SO搵到個完整版

__foo__: this is just a convention, a way for the Python system to use names that won't conflict with user names.

_foo: this is just a convention, a way for the programmer to indicate that the variable is private (whatever that means in Python).

__foo: this has real meaning: the interpreter replaces this name with _classname__foo as a way to ensure that the name will not overlap with a similar name in another class.

No other form of underscores have meaning in the Python world.

There's no difference between class, variable, global, etc in these conventions.

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1301346/what-is-the-meaning-of-a-single-and-a-double-underscore-before-an-object-name

__foo__: this is just a convention, a way for the Python system to use names that won't conflict with user names.

_foo: this is just a convention, a way for the programmer to indicate that the variable is private (whatever that means in Python).

__foo: this has real meaning: the interpreter replaces this name with _classname__foo as a way to ensure that the name will not overlap with a similar name in another class.

No other form of underscores have meaning in the Python world.

There's no difference between class, variable, global, etc in these conventions.

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/1301346/what-is-the-meaning-of-a-single-and-a-double-underscore-before-an-object-name
